properties.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Casper Mountain
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 2 at 4:32PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
The combination of strong winds and fresh snow cover is resulting in
areas of blowing snow across the area. These conditions will likely
persist through tonight and Tuesday morning.

* WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow along with winds of 30 to 40 mph
and gusts of 45 to occasionally 55 mph. Some of the stronger gusts
will likely occur along Outer Drive just south of Casper.

* WHERE...The lower elevations of Natrona County, including Casper.
Casper Mountain will also have these conditions but with sightly
less wind speed.

* WHEN...Now through about 11 AM Tuesday morning. Casper Mountain
will continue to experience some blowing and drifting snow through
most of the day Tuesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If out driving on area highways during this
time frame, anticipate rapidly fluctuating visibility due to
blowing and drifting snow. The visibility will briefly drop to
near zero at times in some areas. Slick, icy roads will also be in
place, where the blowing snow is occurring.

NWSheadline: Strong winds and blowing snow for the rest of this afternoon, through Tuesday morning
